newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Project, FileNet off. [CORRECTED 21:45 GMT]
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Project, FileNet off. [CORRECTED 21:45 GMT]

text.p: Shares of Project Software & Development Inc and FileNet Corp were hammered in pre-opening trading Wednesday.

FileNet shares slipped 5-7/8 to 10 at their last sale, traders said, after the company said weak new orders would cut into first quarter earnings. (Corrects to delete all references to fourth quarter results.)
FileNet, which makes data processing systems using optical disk technology, made the announcement after the close on Tuesday. It also said it plans a restructuring.

FileNet sees a $9.0 million net loss, or $0.60 a share, on revenues of $47 million for the first quarter. A year earlier it posted a net loss of $11.8 million, or $0.79 a share, including a charge, on revenues of $66.7 million.
A source at PaineWebber said earlier the company had been downgraded to hold from buy.
Project Software shares were also selling sharply lower in pre-opening trade.
The stock was off 20, knocking its value down to about 11-1/4.

The company forecast earnings per share of $0.15, compared to $0.24 in the same period last year. Its software is used to maintain high-value capital assets such as plants, facilities and production equipment.
No earlier profit estimates were immediately available for FileNet or Project Software.
